title: HINTS for Stroke in Acute Vestibular Syndrome
desc: The HINTS for Stroke in Acute Vestibular Syndrome diagnoses stroke in patients with acute vestibular syndrome (AVS).

orgreference.text: Kattah JC, Talkad AV, Wang DZ, Hsieh YH, Newman-Toker DE. HINTS to diagnose stroke in the acute vestibular syndrome: three-step bedside oculomotor examination more sensitive than early MRI diffusion-weighted imaging. Stroke. 2009;40(11):3504-10.

other_refer.text: Newman-Toker DE, Kerber KA, Hsieh Y-H, et al. HINTS outperforms ABCD2 to screen for stroke in acute continuous vertigo and dizziness. Goldstein JN, ed. Acad Emerg Med. 2013;20(10):986-996.

HINTS = Head Impulse, Nystagmus, Test of Skew
data.facts:
HINTS exam is benign:

Abnormal h-HIT plus direction-fixed horizontal nystagmus plus absent skew deviation

HINTS exam is dangerous:

Normal/untestable h-HIT or direction-changing horizontal/untestable nystagmus or present/untestable skew deviation
